comment: Very knowledgeable professor, he can answer any question you have. He teaches at a fast pace but is always accessible during office hours. Harsh policies, very little to no sympathy or extra credit. You get what you see in the syllabus, nothing more or less.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: He's solid teacher for Chem classes. Even though there are a lot of homework, but he will try his best to help you finish it. He will be there for you like 24/7 every time you email him he will reply it back so quickly. So i wish i could take his class again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Attendance isnt mandatory, but I would definitely recommend going. He goes fast because there is a lot of content to learn, but he gives a lot of examples to practice. He also gives past ACS exam questions that are very similar to the questions on the exams. He tries his best to make sure everyone understands the content.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Fast paced class, will still be learning test material days before test. DOESNT give extra credit, DOESNT curve the final. A lot of HW, was harder than the learning material. Smartworks worse than ALEKS. Wrote passive aggressive emails. Left class as soon as it was done, couldnt ask him questions. Find a teacher that will curve your final.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Take him! You wont regret it. He gives good lectures and youll actually learn in his class. He gives practice exam questions that are very similar to the exam.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Easily best Chem Lab professor.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Hes a pretty solid choice for lab; he really knows his stuff. He also emails back extremely fast. He replied to an email less than 30 seconds after it had been sent one time which Im pretty sure breaks some kind of record.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class

comment: Tests were completely different from lectures. Lectures were very hard to understand and follow. Honestly, just don't do it
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: His lectures are really good and he doesnt really go by the textbook, he teaches everything in an order that makes sense which is really good. He does have very fast paced lectures so if youre a slow learner I would not take this class, but as long as you do the homework you should do well. He even posts all his lectures online to look
rating_tags: Test heavy--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Took him for inorganic lab and he's great!! He explains everything really well and is really approachable and chill. He lets you do your own thing but is always willing to help. He wants to get you out of there as soon as possible and keeps his pre lectures short. Be careful on citations on reports he's kinda picky about that. TOTALLY RECOMMEND!!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Caring

comment: He's one of those professors that makes things easy. His class is basically powerpoints. Although some of them are vague, he will gladly explain the material if you're struggling. On another note, the hw modules are incredible; it teaches everything. Some people hated it, but with google, I was able to skip class a comfortable number of times.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Mr. Poyraz is a great professor. His test are straightforward. Attendance is not mandatory but if you go to class he puts up practice exam questions that are helpful. I made a 100 in this course. Go to class, do the homework, and youll definitely make an A.

Great guy, but man he could have curved the ACS final at least 5 points. We received NO CURVE on it at all! I am not even joking. Look at other reviews here to see for yourself. He does give bonus points and is a great instructor, but if you have an A before the final, don't be surprised if you have a C after the final.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Whether you take him for gen chem or inorganic, one thing is there across the board, he DOES NOT curve the ACS final!!! Averages on those are usually 40-50 and professors add a 20-30 point curve. Not him! Other than that, he is very nice and only lectures what is on the exam. Easy to pass, but hard to make an A with because no curve on the final.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He's the man for inorganic. 4 exams, 1st was open book/notes, & every exam had 20-30 points of extra credit built-in. Furthermore, 5% of your grade is attendance. The only issue I had with him (and I've also heard in his gen chem class) is that he DOES NOT curve the final, and it's ACS. It's because he gives so much bonus during the semester.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Really straightforward professor. Never goes on rants, always stays on point, and explains things in the best ways possible. Keeps a good timeline, knocks out material quickly, grades tests quickly, and is respectful toward students. Just an all around great professor. My only gripe is that he barely curved the final. But I learned a ton.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Awesome for gen chem! I like to call him "the practical lecturer". He won't waste your time with "random facts" or tangents, he will only lecture what will be on the exams. He gives practice problems similar to the ones on the exam the day before the test, and he has about 2-3 built-in bonus credit questions. Highly recommend!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: Really cool guy for inorganic chem! Super young & very chill in terms of when he's teaching. He let us out like 30 minutes early every day. He can come off as rude and harsh at times, but its because English isn't his first language and I guess stuff gets translated wrong in his head. Extra credit for attendance, and tests have 120-130 pts possible
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He a real g. Bit of a language barrier and can come off as rude at first, but he's chill and he really knows his stuff. His exams aren't bad if you study for them and know you're stuff. Lots of bonus opportunities throughout the semester. Only bad thing is no curve on ACS final (expect a 40-50 on it). Would highly recommend!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: If you're looking for lab review about him, I can't help because he's only taught lectures up until now. In inorganic it starts out easy but then the material/difficulty picks up. The only bad thing is that he did NOT curve the ACS final (usually a 20-30 pt. curve on it), so unfortunately a lot of people lost their As. However, everyone passed.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Had him for inorganic. Super young dude who grades exams within a few hours. Whole semester was 600 points (4 exams worth 100 each, 100 HW points, and 100 point final). Every exam had 120-130 possible points, and he gave 30 bonus points ( 5 points to your overall grade) for attendance and doing a problem in front of the class. Easy B/C. Take him!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Really nice down to earth guy! He never gets mad when you ask questions and you can tell he is really passionate in his field. He does an amazing job explaining material and he's very dedicated.. take him!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: There were 5 exams total, they were roughly around 20 questions and he usually gives 2-3 bonus questions on them. He lectures only whats going to be on the exam, and the class before the exam he gives you practice problems similar to the exam.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: Poyraz is a great professor. This was my second time taking Chem 1211 and he made everything so much easier. His lectures are straight and to the point as well as the tests. He is super helpful and goes over a lot of problems in class. The only issue is that there is a bit of a language barrier but you just have to pay attention.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures
